content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for the cheapest round-trip flights from Bangkok to Madrid, leaving on May 26, 2026, and returning on May 28, 2026, and provide options under $1000.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/travel/flights/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I need to change the departure city from "Toronto" to "Bangkok" to begin my flight search. This is done by editing the "Where from?" input.
Action: Type [13]; Bangkok
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Next, I need to enter "Madrid" as the destination city in the "Where to?" input in order to complete the route required for the search.
Action: Type [14]; Madrid
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Now I need to set the departure and return dates to match the task requirement: leaving on May 26, 2026, and returning on May 28, 2026. The next step is to select the "Departure" date input.
Action: Click [16]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar currently shows only September and October. I need to move to May 2026 to select the required departure and return dates. I should click "Next" to scroll the calendar forward.
Action: Click [74]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.32
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows October and November. Since May 2026 is still not visible, I should continue clicking "Next" to advance the calendar months until May is displayed.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.34
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows November and December. May 2026 is still not visible, so I need to keep clicking "Next" to navigate forward through the months.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.36
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows December and January 2026. Since May 2026 has not yet appeared, I need to keep clicking "Next" to scroll forward to reach May 2026 in the calendar view.
Action: Click [76]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.38
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays January and February 2026. May 2026 is not yet visible, so I need to continue scrolling forward using the "Next" button to reach May.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays February and March 2026. May 2026 is still not visible, so I should continue clicking "Next" to scroll forward to reach May.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.42
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now displays March and April 2026. May 2026 is still not visible, so I should continue clicking "Next" to reach the month of May for date selection.
Action: Click [75]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.44
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar now shows May 2026. I need to select May 26, 2026, as the departure date and May 28, 2026, as the return date. First, I'll select May 26, 2026.
Action: Click [68]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I have selected May 26, 2026, as the departure date. Now I need to select May 28, 2026, as the return date for the round trip.
Action: Click [73]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.75

Thought: Both departure (May 26) and return (May 28) dates are now selected. To proceed and view flight options for these dates, I should click the "Done" button to confirm the selection and move forward in the booking process.
Action: Click [81]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.85

content:
Thought: The cheapest round-trip flight from Bangkok to Madrid for the specified dates is CA$1,075 (shown under Saudia). I need to convert this amount to USD to check if any options are under $1000. The exchange rate is usually near 0.73 (1 CAD ≈ 0.73 USD), so CA$1,075 ≈ $785 USD, thus it meets the requirement.
Action: ANSWER; The cheapest round-trip flight from Bangkok to Madrid, departing May 26, 2026, and returning May 28, 2026, is with Saudia for CA$1,075 (approx. $785 USD), which is under $1000.
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
token: : ANSWER; The cheapest round-trip flight from Bangkok to Madrid, departing May 26, 2026, and returning May 28, 2026, is with Saudia for CA$1,075 (approx. $785 USD), which is under $1000
